Homonyms & Homophones

Posted to Mottr.am by
Jack
on 07 June 2009 from Glasgow. Tags: language
Short URL: http://mottr.am/hh

Hover over the sentences to see a translation and the language of origin.

Bar barbarbarbarbar bar bar barbarbarbarbar.

Buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo.

¿Cómo como? ¿Cómo cómo como? Como como como.

Kokko, kokoo kokoon koko kokko! Koko kokkoko? Koko kokko.

Malo malo malo malo.

Sayang, sayang sayang sayang, sayang sayang sayang?

Vihdoin vihdoin vihdoin.

Etsivät etsivät etsivät etsivät etsivät.

Piilevät piilevät piilevät

Косил косой косой косой косой косой

Comments

Add a comment by tweeting with the hashtag #mot_hh (Help?)

Commenting via Twitter

If you have a Twitter account and would like to reply to this post, just tweet what you'd like to say, and make sure to put #mot_hh somewhere in your tweet.

The gobbledygook beginning with '#' is called a 'hashtag', and makes it easy for this site to search Twitter for your tweet, and display it on the correct page.

Alternatively, you can tweet about this post and include its short URL, http://mottr.am/hh, and your tweet will be displayed automatically, whether you use the hashtag or not.

If you don't have a Twitter account, feel free to send me an email instead, and I'll update the post with your comments: j@ck.mottr.am
